{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presented with headache and blurring of vision. On examination, there is diplopia on looking towards the left in the right eye. This suggests a problem with the optic pathway or brain structure that affects visual processing. The diagnosis should be based on the possible causes of diplopia. Among the options, B: Internuclear ophthalmoplegia is the most relevant as it can cause diplopia and other visual disturbances.", "answer_choice": "B"}
